pageContext.description: 6 rivets preserved in hilt. Small semi-lunar mark below,  3 fine parallel grooves on each side of midrib., Edges worn.
pageContext.other: Under "dagger" on top line, there is "ogival with midrib" crossed out.,  All measurements do not indicate units however following each one is a symbol that looks like a  caterpillar with a dot under the middle of it.
pageContext.associations: Found with cremation in a small cist just below the floor (dug out by treasure hunters, & left in their hole in mediaeval times) together with a small bronze rivetted dagger (qu.), a flint knife, deer horn implements & a grooved whetstone.
pageContext.collection: Private, R.S.Newall. Esq. FSA,, Fisherton Delamere House,, Wylye, Wilts (1930).
pageContext.site: England, Wilts, Amesbury, on Idminston boundary, Barrow, Round (Goddards No. 85, WAM. xxxviii. 17o)
